title: admin UI upgrade code needs to handle upgrading on clusters running a replica security database
description:
See bug 16381.

Off the top of my head:

1. upgrade the master cluster.
2. make sure the replica has received the new security database state.
3. the Admin UI upgrade code will need to detect that it's running on a replica security database, either offer to upgrade or do it automatically, and not attempt to write to the security database if the version is already correct.

changeHistory.comment: Ganesh: I will talk to Wayne and see what we need to do here

An upgrade involves two sets of actions. One is to make changes to the security database, and the other is to make changes to the config files. We use the security-version in the security database to determine whether we need to run the upgrade logic.

When the security database is being replicated, the replica cluster can't run the security database portion of the upgrade because the replica database is read only. This is why we run the upgrade on the master cluster first, and this caused both the master's security database and also its config files to be upgraded.

The updated security database is then replicated to the replica cluster.

At this point, the replica cluster still needs to (potentially) have its config files upgraded but doesn't realize it because it sees the newer security version in the replica security database.

In development, we just access http://localhost:8001/security-upgrade-go.xqy?force=true to force the upgrade logic to run.

For customers, we need a more elegant way to run the config upgrade part of the process. One possibility is to just offer the user a button somewhere to "force upgrade process" that they could be instructed to use on their replica cluster after upgrading the master.

Danny and I were just discussing this some more. We can do better if we put the server version into clusters.xml and update it as part of the upgrade.

1. Add a new security-version element to clusters.xml and clusters.xsd.

2. In Admin/lib/status-check.xqy, we have code to check the security version in the security database. If the version in the security database is correct, but the clusters.xml version is not, then you run the upgrade logic as if the security version is wrong.

On a cluster with a replica security database, if the running server version is different than the clusters.xml version, you should insist on the master security database being upgraded before running the replica's upgrade code.

3. The security logic needs to upgrade clusters.xml to have the new security version.

With these changes, the replica will automatically detect that it needs to upgrade its config files. Having done this work, the upgrade button text can change to only include the part that says you shouldn't need to press the button.
